alert.note: Alert for Hughes; Jones; Lyman; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 9:52PM MDT until June 12 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Jones County in central South Dakota... Southeastern Stanley County in central South Dakota... Eastern Hughes County in central South Dakota... Lyman County in central South Dakota... * Until 1145 PM CDT/1045 PM MDT/. * At 1052 PM CDT/952 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Pierre to Mosher, moving east at 40 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Rousseau around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Cedar Creek Rec Area, Degrey Rec Area, Joe Creek Rec Area and West Bend Rec Area. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. These storms are producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
